0P000070IA.TO.manager_bio: Warner Sulz is Vice President and Senior Portfolio Manager, Canadian Equities. He has been in the investment industry since 1986.

0P000070TB.TO.long_name: Manulife Dividend Income Fund (Capped) MLIP A
0P000070TB.TO.manager_bio: Alan Wicks is a senior managing director and senior portfolio manager for Manulife Asset Management. Alan is founder and team leader for the Value Equity team. The team has won numerous investment awards and accolades over the past 20 years. The team manages multiple strategies for institutional and retail clients, including Canadian All Cap Equity, Canadian Large Cap Value Equity, Canadian Focused Equity, Dividend Income, U.S. Dividend Income, Canadian Balanced, U.S. Balanced and Global Balanced. Alan is the lead manager for all Balanced Strategies.
0P000070TB.TO.short_name: Manuvie FPG PPLM A rev dividend
0P000070TB.TO.summary: The fund invests in companies that offer higher than average dividend yields, providing investors with tax-advantaged income through dividend tax credits.

0P000070V0.TO.manager_bio:
Ian is Head of Canadian Equities for Trimark Investments, based in Toronto.

Ian is from Toronto and began his investment career in 1991 as an account manager in the commercial banking division of the Hongkong Bank of Canada. He has also worked as a manager in corporate credit at The Bank of Nova Scotia. Prior to joining the company in 1997, he was an assistant portfolio manager at the Ontario Teachersâ Pension Plan Board. He earned an MBA and a B.Comm. from McMaster University, and he holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.
0P000070V0.TO.summary: Invesco Canadian Fund seeks to provide strong capital growth with a high degree of reliability over the long term; it invests primarily in common shares of Canadian companies.

0P000071HI.TO.manager_bio: Dina joined Bluewater Investment Management Inc. in 1995 and has been the lead Portfolio Manager on Mackenzie Canadian Growth Fund since then. Bluewater was a subadvisor to Mackenzie until 2016, when it became one of Mackenzieâs investment boutiques. Dina began her career at a large insurance company, directing U.S. equity portfolios. Dina has a BComm from McMaster University and an MBA from the University of Windsor. She is also a CFA charterholder.
0P000071HI.TO.summary: The Fund invests mainly in Canadian equity securities issued by Canadian corporations to achieve long-term capital growth and provide a reasonable rate of return.

0P000071IR.TO.summary: The investment objective of the fund is to provide long-term capital appreciation and to outperform the S&P/TSX Composite Total Return Index.

0P000071SO.TO.long_name: Invesco Canadian Endeavour Fund Series A
0P000071SO.TO.manager_bio:
Clayton is a vice president and portfolio manager for Trimark Investments at Invesco.

Clayton began his career in the financial services industry in 1994 at PricewaterhouseCoopers, where he worked in progressively senior roles as a senior associate, manager and vice president in the corporate finance and investment banking group. He joined the company in 2002 as an investment analyst and became a portfolio manager in 2006. He earned a BBA from Simon Fraser University, and he holds both the Chartered Financial Analyst and Chartered Accountant designations.

Vice-President, Portfolio Manager

0P000072MY.TO.summary: The Fund aims to provide moderate income and long-term capital growth by making socially responsible investments primarily in the Canadian equity markets. The Fund may invest up to 50% of its assets in foreign securities.

0P0000Q5PO.TO.summary: The Fund seeks long-term capital growth through investments primarily in common shares and other equity securities of issuers in Canada and the United States. The strategy of this Fund is to hold a concentrated portfolio of quality companies for the long-term. Thus, the investment portfolio of the Fund will consist of a small number of large positions with very low turnover. It is not expected that the Fund will invest in more than 24 issuers at one time. Companies are purchased that can grow their intrinsic value at above normal rates over a long period of time. Companies generating substantial free cash flow are favoured. Securities of these companies are purchased when they are trading at a substantial discount to their business value.

0P0001BMH2.TO.long_name: AlphaDelta Canadian Momentum Equity Class - Series A
0P0001BMH2.TO.manager_bio: Dennis has been active in the investment industry since 1971. His original degree in Chemical Engineering (1965) was followed by an MBA in 1970. Dennis is a CFA charterholder. After five years in the chemical business, Dennis spent the 1970âs at A.E. Ames & Co. before moving to Elliot & Page in 1980. In 1984 he was the first addition to the Trimark investment team, remaining until 1994 when he left to form Chescott Investment Management Inc. Chescott was merged into Bluewater in 1996.
0P0001BMH2.TO.summary: The fundamental investment objective of the Fund is to provide long-term capital appreciation by investing primarily in equity securities of Canadian and foreign companies. The Fund will invest its portfolio such that it generally falls within the Canadian Focused Equity investment strategy category. As such, the Fund generally invests at least 50%, and less than 90%, of its equity portfolio in securities domiciled in Canada. The Fund will invest no more than 49% of its equity portfolio in foreign securities, with the majority of these foreign securities expected to be domiciled in the United States. The Fundâs portfolio advisor will implement a disciplined, quantitatively driven, risk-managed, price momentum (or relative strength) investment strategy.
